### CHA Animal Shelter is a nonprofit animal shelter serving the people and animals of Central Ohio

We provide safe, temporary shelter and care for abandoned or otherwise homeless cats and dogs, and work to reduce pet overpopulation by means of spay and neuter, education, and community outreach.

[Learn More](https://www.chaanimalshelter.org/about/)

WHAT'S NEW PUSSYCAT?
--------------------

[Visit Our Adoption Center](https://colonycats.org/#S7)_•_[Volunteer of the Month](https://colonycats.org/#S8)

[Prevent More. Fix at Four](https://colonycats.org/#S5)_•_[Barn Cats Work for You](https://colonycats.org/#S6)_•_[Adoption Center Wish List](https://colonycats.org/#S2)

[Enroll in Kroger Rewards](https://colonycats.org/#S3)_•_[Shop at Chewy.com](https://colonycats.org/#S4)_•_[Become a Volunteer](https://colonycats.org/#S1)
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Be sure to check our _[EVENTS](https://colonycats.org/events.html)_ page often _[(and "like" us on Facebook)](https://www.facebook.com/ColonyCatsandDogs)_ to keep informed about fun events, fundraisers, and what we (and the cats & dogs) are up to. We're also on _[Instagram!](https://www.instagram.com/colonycats/)_

![Image 1: picture of cats looking out of the adoption center window](https://colonycats.org/images/wereopen.jpg)

### OUR ADOPTION CENTER IS OPEN!

Come by for a visit

_Adoption Center Hours:

Tues – Fri•4pm - 7pm

Sat/Sun•12 noon – 4pm

 (closed Monday)_

Colony Cats Adoption Center is open to the public for regular hours. Come by and visit all of our wonderful adoptable cats and kittens. Interact with our cats as they play, perch, or snooze. You never know...you might just meet your forever furiend!

_No Same-Day Adoptions or holds on cats or kittens_•Guests with pre-approved applications can finalize adoptions during their visit. We encourage you to [submit our online adoption application](https://colonycats.org/adoptions.html#S4) for pre-approval.

_For adoption information, to view our available pets, or to submit an online adoption application for pre-approval [click here to visit our Adopt page](https://colonycats.org/adoptions.html)._

![Image 2: Photo of Marina](https://colonycats.org/images/vomimgmarina.jpg)

### August Volunteer of the Month:

MARINA

We love our volunteers! They give so much to help us, so we're giving them a big "shout-out" with our Volunteer of the Month feature.

Introducing our August Volunteer of the Month – Marina. The thing she likes best about volunteering for Colony Cats is getting to see the cats from when they first arrive sometimes scared or sick, to becoming healthy and happy, and finally when they get to go to their new home.

Marina's advice for new Colony Cats volunteers is to be aware and inquisitive, and don't be afraid to ask questions. _[Click here](https://colonycats.org/documents/vomdocmarina.pdf) to read more and learn about Marina._

![Image 3: picture of a black and white cat caption says Got Pests? Hire a Barn Cat](https://colonycats.org/images/barncat.jpg)

### HIRE OUR BARNYARD GUARDIANS 

TO WORK FOR YOU!

Our Barnyard Guardians are all-natural, pesticide-free, rodent controllers. Whether you have a barn, warehouse, brewery, horse farm, grainery, etc., these beautiful healthy cats are pros at keeping pesty critters from moving in.

We provide spayed/neutered, rabies vaccinated, feral/semi-feral cats. (We do ask that you take two for bonding.) You provide shelter, daily food/water (cats can't live on mice alone), and veterinary care as needed. Most importantly you provide a second chance at life for a pair of homeless cats who may have had a less fortunate future.

_[Click Here](https://colonycats.org/documents/ccbarncats.pdf) to download our Barn Cats Information Flyer_ for more details. Print it out and share it with someone you know who might benefit from these helpers. If you have any questions, or are interested in barn cats _call 614-570-0471_ – leave a message and we will contact you – or _[click here to email.](mailto:volunteer@colonycats.org)_

_Ready to adopt a pair of barn cats?_ _[Click here](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdNQUHVVXoFWTZlsp6KX6Zdnx-WhR4-n47NRfm3dLFF4uyYqA/viewform?usp=sf\_link)_ to fill out and submit our Barn Cat adoption application.

![Image 4: Photo of cat with food dish that says uh-oh](https://colonycats.org/images/fixatfour.jpg)

### PREVENT MORE. FIX AT MONTH FOUR.

Spay and Neuter at 4-Months Old

Cats and dogs can get pregnant much sooner than you think. 50% of all pets born are accidents. _Spay or neuter your pet at four months old to help prevent those accidents_ and save millions from being killed in shelters each year. _[Click here](https://www.alleycat.org/our-work/spayneuter/)_ to read an _Alley Cat Allies_ article on why spay and neuter at 4 months old is so important. _[Click here](https://resources.bestfriends.org/article/understanding-spay-and-neuter)_ for a great article from Best Friends Animal Society about the importance of spay and neuter.

Colony Cats is excited to announce that we are a network partner of _[Best Friends Animal Society](http://bestfriends.org/What-We-Do/Our-Work/)_. Best Friends believes that collaboration with local pet shelters and animal rescue organizations – the people who know their communities best – is key to ending the killing in America’s shelters.

_[Click here](https://colonycats.org/services.html#S1)to see our listing of local, low-cost spay/neuter resources._

[![Image 5: Order your Pet Food at Chewy.com and Colony Cats (& dogs) will get a $20 donation!](https://cms-www.chewy.com/images/partners/rescue/banners/cw-shelter-200x200.png)](https://www.chewy.com/rp/7087)

### ORDER FROM CHEWY.COM

 and Colony Cats Gets a Donation!

Here's an easy way to help our organization _[– order your pet food at Chewy.com](https://www.chewy.com/rp/7087)_ and Chewy will proudly make a donation* of $20 to Colony Cats (& dogs)! (*Valid for first-time customers only, one per household.)

Chewy.com has a huge selection of pet food, treats and supplies. They offer fast, free shipping, and 24/7 customer service.

Thanks for taking part in this easy way to support Colony Cats. Ask your friends and family too! Be sure to order using our special link _[https://www.chewy.com/rp/7087](https://www.chewy.com/rp/7087)_ or _click the orange "Shop Now" button above._

![Image 6: Picture of a kitten poking it's head out of a Kroger brown paper bag](https://colonycats.org/images/krogerrewardsenrollkitty.jpg)

### KROGER COMMUNITY REWARDS

It's a great time to enroll!

_Looking for an easy way to help Colony Cats? Well look no further than your grocery bag._ It's free to take part – just swipe your Kroger Plus card each time you shop and Colony Cats earns a rebate.

It's a great time to sign-up. Go to the _[KROGER WEBSITE](https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards)_ and _"Sign In"_ or follow the instructions to _"Create an Account"_, then choose Colony Cats as your Community Rewards recipient. Colony Cats group number is _CT262._

Once you're registered you'll see Colony Cats listed at the bottom of your store receipts as your community rewards recipient. There's no cost for you to take part – just swipe your Kroger Plus card when you check-out, and Colony Cats automatically earns dollars!

Thank you for taking part in this easy way to support Colony Cats. Spread the word and ask your friends and family to sign up too!

![Image 7: Colony Cats Adoption Center Wish List](https://colonycats.org/images/wishlist.gif)

### ADOPTION CENTER WISH LIST

A great way you can help out is to donate useful and much needed items to Colony Cats Adoption Center.

_Here's a \_[wish list](https://colonycats.org/documents/ccwishlist.pdf)\_ our kitties put together_ - print it and take it with you while shopping, or post it in your community. Your donation of items will help make their wishes come true!! (Of course, their biggest wish of all is a forever home.)

Please drop off items during the Adoption Center's open hours: Tue–Fri 4 pm-7 pm • Sat–Sun 12-4 pm

2740 Festival Lane, Dublin OH 43017 • 614-570-0471

_Donate items using Colony Cats' [Amazon Wish List.](https://www.amazon.com/registry/wishlist/7LNDVYR3W1XW/ref=cm\_sw\_r\_cp\_ep\_ws\_QDeaCbWFXKBEZ)_ Quickly and easily purchase food, litter and other supplies you wish to donate and Amazon ships them directly to us. _[Click here to shop on Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/registry/wishlist/7LNDVYR3W1XW/ref=cm\_sw\_r\_cp\_ep\_ws\_QDeaCbWFXKBEZ)_ for useful items we've picked out. It's an easy way to donate supplies, and help the cats & dogs in our care!

_Donate items using Colony Cats' [Chewy.com Wish List.](https://www.chewy.com/g/colony-cats\_b64636810)_ Quickly and easily purchase food, litter and other supplies you wish to donate and Chewy ships them directly to us. _[Click here to shop on Chewy.com](https://www.chewy.com/g/colony-cats\_b64636810)_ for items we've picked out. Another way to easily donate supplies, and help the cats & dogs in our care!

![Image 8: Pictures of cats at adoption center](https://colonycats.org/images/volwithbenefits.jpg)

### VOLUNTEERING - WITH BENEFITS

At Colony Cats Adoption Center, the "pawsitives" of volunteering abound - literally! As a helper at our cageless center, you will be entertained by the playful antics of our cat adoptees - they're up, down and all around! Pitch in with other animal lovers to keep the center tidy and care for the cats. Hours are flexible to your schedule.

If one of your favorite sounds is "meow" please contact us now! 614-570-0471 or by [email](mailto:volunteer@colonycats.org).

_Colony Cats Adoption Center:_

2740 Festival Lane, Dublin OH 43017 

Hours: Tue–Fri 4 pm – 7 pm • Sat–Sun 12 noon – 4 pm

Ready to get started? 

_Just download and fill out the [Volunteer Opportunities and Application Form and Waiver.](https://colonycats.org/documents/ccvolunteeroppsappwaiver.pdf)_

You can either _bring it by the Adoption Center_ (address above),

_email it to us at: [volunteer@colonycats.org](mailto:volunteer@colonycats.org)_

_or mail it to: Colony Cats, P.O. Box 163904, Columbus, OH 43216-3904_

Want to help us spread the word? _[Click here](https://colonycats.org/documents/ccvolunteerhandout.pdf) to download our Adoption Center Volunteer Flyer._

Print it out, and share with your friends and family. The more the "meowier"!

_If you have any questions about volunteering or need further information, please [click here](mailto:volunteer@colonycats.org) to contact us at volunteer@colonycats.org_ (Please note: We do have a limited number of youth volunteer opportunities for those under 15 years of age. All volunteers under 15 years of age must be accompanied by their parent.)

![Image 9: Thank you all for making our 14th annual Garden Party a success!](https://colonycats.org/images/ccgp2024tybigsponsors.jpg)

### Heartfelt thanks for everyone's support. Together we are saving lives!

Thank you to all who attended, sponsored, donated to, and volunteered at our 14th annual Garden Party. With your help we are able to provide animal welfare services in Central Ohio.

WE BELIEVE
==========

Our approach to advancing animal welfare is based on the belief that innovation should be constant. And that moving forward with thought-leading programs that enrich, fulfill and, yes, save lives is more than a goal. It’s a given.

![Image 22: THRIVE.png](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/5bb4fae2e5f7d16d8cc91e46/1538592572490-L9N0M72KERTGG7SQVD46/THRIVE.png)

### it’s what happens when you raise expectations

When you provide resources that open doors, offer help, share knowledge and invite involvement, you are raising the bar. For pets. For people. For the entire community. **When that happens, everyone thrives.**

CRUELTY INVESTIGATIONS
======================

As the law enforcement agency responsible for investigating animal cruelty in Franklin County, we are the first line of defense between animals and those who mistreat them.

=============

There’s 140 years of expertise reflected in our newly renovated space. Stimulating environments that reduce stress on animals. A state-of-the-art hospital that enables a higher level of care. About the Franklin County Dog Shelter & Adoption Center

Each year, we help thousands of dogs find their second chance.

The**Franklin County Dog Shelter & Adoption Center**, located in Columbus, Ohio, is a temporary home for thousands of dogs each year, many of whom arrive needing a little extra care and healing before they’re ready to join a new family.
